channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A small business owner in Kansas City has created a legal option for street racing
item.description: At illegal side shows or street takeovers, drivers show off their skills and their cars. Now a side show advocate in Kansas City says he's created a legal way that drivers can take part.
item.content:encoded: At illegal side shows or street takeovers, drivers show off their skills and their cars. Now a side show advocate in Kansas City says he's created a legal way that drivers can take part.
item.dc:creator: Brandon Azim

item.title: Farmers say they've 'hit rock bottom,' but still believe next year will be better
item.description: The Trump administration has hit farmers hard by shattering their export markets with trade wars, gutting USAID, squeezing the farm labor market, and demonizing oil seed crops and a farm herbicide.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration has hit farmers hard by shattering their export markets with trade wars, gutting USAID, squeezing the farm labor market, and demonizing oil seed crops and a farm herbicide.
item.dc:creator: Frank Morris

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Christmas festivities return to Bethlehem, Trump-backed conservative candidate wins Honduras' presidential election, a look at how Trump's immigration policies have affected families this year.
item.content:encoded: Christmas festivities return to Bethlehem, Trump-backed conservative candidate wins Honduras' presidential election, a look at how Trump's immigration policies have affected families this year.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: IT meltdowns have grounded planes. What airlines can learn from them
item.description: Alaska Airlines is the latest airline to ground its planes because of an IT meltdown. We talked to industry leaders about why these systems fail and what airlines can learn from past disruptions.
item.content:encoded: Alaska Airlines is the latest airline to ground its planes because of an IT meltdown. We talked to industry leaders about why these systems fail and what airlines can learn from past disruptions.
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: DOJ says it may need a 'few more weeks' to finish releasing Epstein files
item.description: The Justice Department said Wednesday that it may need a "few more weeks" to release its records on the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein after discovering more than a million potentially relevant documents.
item.content:encoded:
The Justice Department said Wednesday that it may need a "few more weeks" to release its records on the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein after discovering more than a million potentially relevant documents.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: A Powerball player in Arkansas has won a $1.817 billion lottery jackpot
item.description: Wednesday's Christmas Eve drawing ended the lottery game's three-month stretch without a top-prize winner. Final ticket sales pushed the jackpot higher, making it the second-largest in U.S. history.
item.content:encoded:
Wednesday's Christmas Eve drawing ended the lottery game's three-month stretch without a top-prize winner. Final ticket sales pushed the jackpot higher, making it the second-largest in U.S. history.

(Image credit: Charles Krupa)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 2025 has seen an explosion of AI-generated slop
item.description: 2025 has seen an explosion in AI-generated slop. NPR's Geoff Brumfiel and Shannon Bond discuss how AI-generated videos are shaping reality online.
item.content:encoded: 2025 has seen an explosion in AI-generated slop. NPR's Geoff Brumfiel and Shannon Bond discuss how AI-generated videos are shaping reality online.
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: New Epstein files mention Trump. And, SCOTUS rules on National Guard in Chicago
item.description: The DOJ released tens of thousands of new documents related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. And, the Supreme Court ruled that the National Guard must stay out of Chicago.
item.content:encoded:
The DOJ released tens of thousands of new documents related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. And, the Supreme Court ruled that the National Guard must stay out of Chicago.

(Image credit: Davidoff Studios)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: ICE officer accused of excessive force, then sent back to work despite active probe
item.description: DHS's handling of the incident raises questions about the department's oversight mechanisms to investigate employee misconduct.
item.content:encoded:
DHS's handling of the incident raises questions about the department's oversight mechanisms to investigate employee misconduct.

(Image credit: Stephanie Keith)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: 35 years after ADA, people with disabilities still find hotels unaccommodating
item.description: AN NPR survey finds that people with disability still find hotels unaccommodating, even 35 years after passage of the Americans with Disabilities Act.
item.content:encoded:
AN NPR survey finds that people with disability still find hotels unaccommodating, even 35 years after passage of the Americans with Disabilities Act.

(Image credit: Richard Beaven for NPR, via Cory Lee, Zayrha Rodriguez/NPR and via Karen Lohr)
item.dc:creator: Joseph Shapiro
